raw_text:
Bath faced with Tindall ultimatum
 
 Mike Tindall's agent has warned Bath they have until next week to improve their contract offer to the England man or risk losing him to a rival club.
 
 Dipo Alli says he has received an offer for Tindall which dwarfs Bath's deal and that two other clubs want to talk. "Mike does not want to go into the Six Nations worrying about where he will be playing his club rugby next season," Alli told the Guardian newspaper. "It is up to (Bath owner) Andrew Brownsword. He has to make it happen." Tindall is out of contract at the end of the season but it is understood that Brownsword is unwilling to break the club's salary structure to accommodate the 26-year-old's demands. But Alli insists the player is worth more than Bath have put on the table. "Mike has been at Bath for eight years and wants to remain with the club and his demands are anything but excessive," the agent added. "But Brownsword has to recognise Mike's value and we want to resolve things by the end of next week."
llama3.2:1b: Bath Rugby owner Andrew Brownsword is facing an ultimatum from Mike Tindall's agent regarding a contract extension offer. The agent claims Tindall will consider leaving Bath if they don't meet his demands, which are reportedly worth more than what Bath has offered. The club faces pressure to make a decision by the end of the week to prevent Tindall's departure.
llama3.2:3b: Bath faces an ultimatum from Mike Tindall's agent, Dipo Alli, who says a rival club has offered Tindall a contract that dwarfs Bath's deal. Two other clubs are also interested in signing him. Bath owner Andrew Brownsword is unwilling to break the salary structure to accommodate Tindall's demands, but his agent believes Tindall is worth more and wants the issue resolved by the end of next week.
gemma2:2b: Mike Tindall's agent warned Bath they must improve their contract offer for him or risk losing him to another club before the Six Nations starts.  The player wants to stay with Bath but the club's owner, Andrew Brownsword, is unwilling to exceed their salary structure. The agent insists Tindall is worth more than the current offer and calls on Brownsword to resolve the situation by next week.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Bath owner Andrew Brownsword faces tough negotiations with England coach Dipo Alli, as Bath's offer for Mike Tindall dwarfs his previous contract. Tindall is out of contract at the end of the season but is reportedly worth more than the club has offered to replace him in the Six Nations. Brownsword has until next week to address the matter.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Bath faces losing Mike Tindall due to lack of improvement in contract offer and is willing to accept a significant increase over what Bath currently offers, but owner Andrew Brownsword refuses to break the salary structure.
qwen2.5:3b: Mike Tindall's agent warns Bath they must improve their contract offer or risk losing him to another club before the season ends, citing rival offers that outvalue Bath's deal. Dipo Alli, Tindall's agent, insists the player is worth more than what Bath has offered and demands a resolution by next week, despite Andrew Brownsword unwilling to break the club’s salary structure.

The player himself remains open-minded about negotiations but says he cannot afford to leave his current club without assurances of playing time in the upcoming Six Nations season.

However, Bath owner Andrew Brownsworth is reluctant to alter the club's financial structure to meet Tindall's demands. Alli emphasized that Tindall's value is substantial and urged Brownsworth to recognize it by the end of next week.
